left.title: Progressive / Open-Border Arguments
points: America is a nation of immigrants; moral duty to welcome those fleeing violence and poverty
Undocumented immigrants pay billions in taxes while being ineligible for most benefits
Mass deportation would destroy families and cost $300–600 billion
Legal immigration quotas have not kept up with labor demand

right.title: Conservative / Restrictionist Arguments
points: Uncontrolled borders enable crime, drugs (especially fentanyl), and human trafficking
Large-scale low-skill immigration depresses wages for working-class Americans
Nations have a sovereign right and duty to control who enters
Current levels strain schools, hospitals, and welfare systems

left.title: Pro-Choice Arguments
points: Bodily autonomy: no one should be forced to use their body to sustain another life
Bans do not stop abortions, they make them unsafe
Most Americans support legal abortion in all or most cases (Pew 2024)
Restrictive laws disproportionately harm poor and minority women

right.title: Pro-Life Arguments
points: Human life begins at conception; abortion is the ending of an innocent human life
Modern science (fetal heartbeat at 6 weeks, pain capability by 20 weeks)
Society protects the vulnerable – unborn children are the most vulnerable
Adoption is a compassionate alternative

left.title: Aggressive Climate Action Arguments
points: Scientific consensus: human activity is primary driver of global warming
Extreme weather events already costing hundreds of billions
Green energy now cheaper than fossil fuels in many regions
Moral obligation to future generations

right.title: Energy Realism / Skeptic Arguments
points: Current green tech cannot replace fossil fuels without massive reliability problems
Aggressive net-zero policies raise energy prices and hurt the poor
Climate models have consistently over-predicted warming
Economic growth and adaptation are more effective than forced degrowth

left.title: Pro-Choice Arguments
points: Bodily autonomy: no person should be forced to sustain another life with their body
Abortion bans don’t stop abortions — they make them unsafe and drive women to desperation
Most Americans support legal abortion in all or most cases (Pew, Gallup 2024–2025)
Restrictive laws disproportionately harm low-income and minority women

right.title: Pro-Life Arguments
points: Human life begins at conception; abortion intentionally ends an innocent human life
Science shows unique DNA, heartbeat at ~6 weeks, pain capacity by 20 weeks
Society has a duty to protect the most vulnerable, including the unborn
Adoption is a loving, life-affirming alternative

left.title: Progressive / Affirmation Arguments
points: Trans people deserve to live authentically; denial of care increases suicide risk
Gender-affirming healthcare is supported by every major medical association (AMA, APA, AAP)
Same-sex marriage and anti-discrimination laws are basic civil rights
‘Don’t Say Gay’ laws and bathroom bills endanger LGBTQ youth

right.title: Conservative / Biology-First Arguments
points: Biological sex is binary and immutable; redefining it erases women’s rights and spaces
Rapid-onset gender dysphoria in teens and social contagion concerns are real
Minors cannot consent to irreversible puberty blockers and surgeries
Fairness in women’s sports and privacy in locker rooms/bathrooms matter

left.title: Open & Humane Arguments
points: Immigrants commit crimes at lower rates than native-born citizens
Dreamers and long-term residents deserve a path to citizenship
Family separation and mass deportation are cruel and logistically impossible
America’s aging workforce needs young immigrant labor

right.title: Secure Borders First Arguments
points: Record illegal crossings since 2021 have overwhelmed cities and schools
Fentanyl deaths (100k+/year) largely flow through the southern border
Nations lose sovereignty when they cannot control who enters
Legal immigration yes, illegal immigration no — enforce the law

left.title: Defund / Reimagine Policing Arguments
points: Black Americans are 2.5–3× more likely to be killed by police than white Americans
Billions spent on militarized policing could fund mental health, housing, education
Qualified immunity shields bad officers; accountability is nearly impossible
‘Broken windows’ policing criminalizes poverty and minor offenses

right.title: Law & Order / Back the Blue Arguments
points: Police killings are rare (~1,000/year) compared to 200k+ violent crimes police stop
Defunding led to crime spikes in 2020–2023 (FBI data)
Most officers are professional; bad apples don’t justify demonizing the profession
Body cameras and better training are the real solutions, not abolition

left.title: Pro-DEI / Equity Arguments
points: Historical discrimination created lasting disparities that require active correction
Diverse teams outperform homogeneous ones (McKinsey, Harvard studies)
Meritocracy doesn’t exist in an unequal society; DEI levels the playing field
Representation matters — people need to see themselves in leadership

right.title: Anti-DEI / Colorblind Merit Arguments
points: DEI often means discriminatory hiring and promotion against whites and Asians
Judging people by skin color instead of merit is the definition of racism
Corporate DEI trainings have been shown to increase bias, not reduce it
True equality is treating everyone the same, regardless of identity
